Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type A kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; narrow band on top of rim; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (part of face and lower body missing; with red on wing), to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos identifies the sherd as belonging to a Chalice Style phiale mesomphalos. However, the depiction of the sphinx is very close to the rim of the vessel suggesting that there were two friezes on the exterior surface of the drinking vessel, and such friezes are found on Type A kantharoi. See British Museum 1924,1201.290 for one such example. For other parallels, see Williams 1983, 169-171, fig. 12. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 297, no. 980, pl. 137)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1653) (phase 2)
